title: 821-00239 Critical software update
message:
Im working on a 821-00239 with message about critical software update when tryin to boot in to system. Have tried with new known good lcd, with disconnected touchbar, touchid. Can boot in safe mode no touchbar in safe mode. Have made new install of OS.

Found very small waterdamage in  area J4200 cleaned it and same result with cable disconncted. 

Any suggestions from someone more familiar with this boards?

title: 821-00239 Critical software update
message:
Did you check all dukefawks mentioned?
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/touchbar-critical-software-update-required.58379/[/URL]

title: 821-00239 Critical software update
message: yes, as I wrote in first post I already tried whats mentioned in that post, SSD seems to be fine as I can boot in safe mode, delete and reinstall and so on. Should touchbar work in safe mode on this?

title: 821-00239 Critical software update
message:
Touchbar driver is not loaded on safe mode.

I cannot locate J4200 on schematic...

title: 821-00239 Critical software update
message:
You can try the steps mentioned in other posts,

Did you try another touchbar?

title: 821-00239 Critical software update
message: have not tried another touchbar, just tried with touchbar disconnected. And searched the forum for suggestions what to try

title: 821-00239 Critical software update
message:
Many suggestions gathered from Internet, already posted on the forum.
There are some software things to try too.

title: 821-00239 Critical software update
message: yes I know and have read all I find, only thing I have not tried are another touchbar just disconnected without result

title: 821-00239 Critical software update
message: I have had 2 with this error. Spend some time finding a solution. In both cases it was TB cable/connector damaged by fluid. TB was not recognised and it led to "Critical Software Update". After cleaning TB lid up and no CSU.

title: 821-00239 Critical software update
message: now tried with new touchbar and still same problem. Guess I have to give up on this one.
